turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I'll give you something you've been jerking off about ever since our parents got married.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Be more specific.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: In English.  I'll fuck your brains out.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: What makes you think I'd go for that bet? That's a seventy thousand dollar car.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Because I'm the only person you can't control and it kills you.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: You can put it anywhere.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Even there?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: It would feel so yummy.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Fuck her yet?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I'm working on it.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Loser.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Blow me.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Call me later.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: You would not believe what--

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Shhh.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: What's wrong with you?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: You ready for this? I've recently discovered that our good friend Mrs. Caldwell is the one who sent the letter to Annette urging her to stay away from me.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Interesting.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I now plan to devote all my energies to destroying the douche bag. Any luck corrupting her daughter?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Call Cecile up and get her to come over. I'll bust that cherry in a heartbeat.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: The plot thickens. It appears that Cecile has fallen for her music teacher.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Ooo, I'm sure Mrs. Caldwell will love that.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Not to mention Court Reynolds. Unfortunately, Ronald's moving with the speed of a Special Olympic Bobsledder.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: What's your plan of attack?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I rat Cecile out to mommy. Mommy goes ballistic and ends their relationship. Boo hoo.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: But who will they turn to for help?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I'm at your service.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Thank you. Mmmm, that feels good.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Oh sis. You're so tense.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I hate when things don't go my way. It makes me so horny.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I hate it too.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Moving along quite well.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Have you succeeded in your task?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Any day now.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Well, let me know when you do. Until then.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Who are you calling?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Cecile.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Before we go through with this, I just want you to be aware of the damage we're going to cause.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I'm aware.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Are you really? I mean, we've done some pretty fucked up shit in our time but this... I mean, we're destroying an innocent girl. You do realize that.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: What is that? Oh my God, it's your conscience.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: You amaze me.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Eat me, Sebastian. It's alright for you to fuck everyone, but because I'm a girl it's wrong. Well let me tell you something, I didn't ask to be a girl. Do you think I relish the fact that I have to act like Mary Sunshine twenty four seven, so I can be considered a "laaaady." Do you think I take great delight when I hear - "Kathryn is so wonderful." "Kathryn is a model child." "Kathryn is going to make an excellent wife one day."  I'm the Marsha fucking Brady of the upper East Side and sometimes I want to kill myself for it. No, I don't enjoy being a part of the weaker sex and for that reason everyone around me is going to suffer. So there's your psychoanalysis Doctor Freud. Now are you in or are you out?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I just had a nice chat with Cecile. I don't think she'll be giving you anymore problems.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Yippy.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Who are you spying on?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Take a look for yourself.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: That her?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Jesus, she reeks of Laura Ashley.  Oh, she's crying. Wittle baby's upset by the big bad book.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: What's your problem?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: She's really getting to you, isn't she?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: If you must know, yes. I don't know what to do. I can't stand that holier than thou bullshit and yet, I'm completely infatuated with her.  She made me laugh.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: And that's why you're losing your bet?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I'm not losing the bet. It's just taking longer than I expected.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Do you mind if I take my new Porsche for a ride?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Kathryn, the only thing you're going to be riding is me. Now if you'll excuse me, I have some work to do.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Morning!

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Morning.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: So? How'd it go last night?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: With who?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Well I know how it went with Cecile. She won't shut up about it. How'd it go with Mrs. Jesus?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: If your asking if I nailed her the answer is no.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: She shot you down.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Exactly the opposite.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: So what went wrong?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I don't know. She was lying on the bed, ready to do it, but I-- I don't, I was... I just didn't feel right about it.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: You're telling me you had the chance to fuck her and you didn't. God are you a chump.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: A momentary lapse of judgment, soon to be rectified.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: If you're heading towards her room, you won't find her.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Where is she?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: You don't know?  She left thirty minutes ago.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Where'd she go?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: She wouldn't say. She apologized to your aunt and told her she was going to stay with some friends.  You blew it, Sebastian. That girl has come to her senses and she will never go near you again.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Bad time?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Kind of.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Well, you obviously wanted me to witness your little adventure or else you wouldn't have invited me in.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: You didn't?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Oh yes.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Tell me all the details.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: It was... Fantastic.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Oh come on. For her first time?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I know. That's the amazing part of it. I mean, it wasn't like Cirque du Soleil acrobatics, just standard missionary stuff, but it was... ah forget it. I'm going to sound like a Hallmark card.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: No, tell me.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: It was... it was like the emotional part outweighed the physical part.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Wow. So you made love. Ooo, I hear the birds chirping.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Mock, mock, mock.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Some other time.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I'm not in the mood.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: And that's why you're leaving?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: It clearly is why.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I want to fuck.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: And I don't.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Oh my God. You're completely p-whipped.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: No, I'm not.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: P-whipped, p-whipped.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: What's wrong with you? Why are you acting this way?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I'm sorry. It's just upsetting. You're in love with her. You don't love me anymore.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Oh come on, Kathryn, it was just a contest.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: At first it was, but now it's become something bigger.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Kathryn, you know I love you. I've always loved you.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Not anymore you don't. It's obvious.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I can't believe you're reacting this way. You're just saying this because you lost the bet.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Is that what you think?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: That's not fair. You're taking all the fun out of it.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Then do me a favor and get rid of her. If not for me, then do it for you. Look at yourself. You're a joke. She's turned you into jelly. What do you want to be, one of those losers who walk down the halls holding hands and smiling. People used to respect you. They feared you and now you're going to throw that all away.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Why so nervous?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I've never done this before.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: How have you dumped girls in the past?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Screening calls. Any suggestions?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I knew this guy last summer in the Hamptons. He and his girlfriend at the time were madly in love with each other. But she had this huge weight problem. His friends taunted him mercilessly about it. You know, "How do you breathe when she sits on your face?" "It's embarrassing for you to be seen with her." Finally he couldn't take it anymore and decided to dump her. She flipped and he went on the defensive. I distinctly remember him saying the same thing over and over again. "I'm completely fucked up." "I'm completely fucked up." "I'm completely fucked up."  Poor fatty never had a chance.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: A little melodramatic, don't you think.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I have a flair for drama.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Mind if I ask what you're doing in my room?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: You wanted an answer to your question.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Annette?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Devastated beyond repair. I doubt she'll ever trust a man again.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Well done.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I thought we should celebrate.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I'd love to, but unfortunately I'm expecting some company.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Ronald?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Not that it's any of your business but yes.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Well done.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Thank you. Now, where were we?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: To my triumph, of course.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Not my choice of toast, but it's your call. To your triumph over Annette.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Silly rabbit. My triumph isn't over her. It's over you.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Come again?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: You were very much in love with her and you're still in love with her. But it amused me to make you ashamed of it. You gave up on the first person you ever loved because I called you names. Don't get me wrong, I'm flattered that you chose me over her, but please understand, I never loved you, Sebastian. You're just a toy. A little toy I play with. And now you've completely blown it with her. I think that's the saddest thing I've ever heard.  Cheers.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: In any event, you still owe me my reward.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I'm sorry, but unfortunately I don't fuck losers.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Get off me!

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Will you calm down?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Fine! Get off me!

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I'm very sorry about that. I apologize.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I accept. Now get out.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Get out? We had an arrangement.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Didn't you hear what I said?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I don't care what you said, we had an agreement. You've slept with half of the borough so don't tell me you're being choosy.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Get out!

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I'm giving you to the count of three to plop your ass down on the bed.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: And if I don't?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Then I will consider it a declaration of war. One. Two... three.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I think you have your answer.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: War it is.

turns.speaker: MRS. CALDWELL
turns.text: I can't tell you how happy we are that Cecile is going to be attending Oakwood with you this fall. You've always been an inspiration to Beau and I on raising her. We just hope she can rise to the high standards which you've set for her.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I'll do my best.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: You're too kind.

turns.speaker: MRS. CALDWELL
turns.text: How do you do it? I mean with all peer pressuring that goes on in high school. Where do you get your strength?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I know this sounds corny, but whenever I feel temptations of peer pressure, I...  turn to God and he helps me through the problem. Call me an anachronism, but it works.

turns.speaker: MRS. CALDWELL
turns.text: That's beautiful.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Don't worry, it's totally understandable. Most of the boys that matriculate at Oakwood are very upstanding gentleman, however there are the occasional bad apples.

turns.speaker: MRS. CALDWELL
turns.text: Like your step-brother Sebastian. I can't believe they didn't expel him after what he did to the school nurse.

turns.speaker: MRS. CALDWELL
turns.text: I got your message and came as quick as I could.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I hope I didn't keep you from something.

turns.speaker: MRS. CALDWELL
turns.text: Not at all. What's wrong?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: It's Cecile.

turns.speaker: MRS. CALDWELL
turns.text: What about her?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Well... you promise you won't say anything to her. We've developed a friendship and...

turns.speaker: MRS. CALDWELL
turns.text: Kathryn, you have my word. It isn't drugs is it?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: It's worse. I think there's something going on between Cecile and her music teacher.

turns.speaker: MRS. CALDWELL
turns.text: Ronald? That's crazy.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I know. She's so young and he's so -

turns.speaker: MRS. CALDWELL
turns.text: Black.

turns.speaker: MRS. CALDWELL
turns.text: I can't thank you enough.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: You will be discreet about this?

turns.speaker: MRS. CALDWELL
turns.text: Absolutely.

turns.speaker: MRS. CALDWELL
turns.text: Let me get that for you.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Oh please. I can't have you do that.

turns.speaker: MRS. CALDWELL
turns.text: It's the least I can do.

turns.speaker: MRS. CALDWELL
turns.text: Who the hell do you think you are?!

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Excuse me.

turns.speaker: MRS. CALDWELL
turns.text: I'm paying you to give cello lessons. Not to pervert my child.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Mrs. Caldwell I think you're misunderstanding something.

turns.speaker: MRS. CALDWELL
turns.text: Is that so?

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Got me off the streets? I live on 59th and Park.

turns.speaker: MRS. CALDWELL
turns.text: Whatever. You are never to set foot in this house again and you are never and I mean never to see my daughter again. Is that understood?!

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: First of all, maam, I never touched your daughter and second, I would like to think that in these times someone of your status could look beyond racial lines.

turns.speaker: MRS. CALDWELL
turns.text: Oh don't give me any of that racist crap. My husband and I gave money to Colin Powell.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: I guess that puts me in my place. Thank you for the hospitality Mrs. Caldwell. It was a true awakening.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Hi. Is Annette at home?

turns.speaker: MRS. O'SHEA
turns.text: You must be Sebastian. I've heard such nice things about you.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: It's desperate that I talk to her.

turns.speaker: MRS. O'SHEA
turns.text: I've already told you, she's not home.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Well please leave a message that I called.

turns.speaker: MRS. O'SHEA
turns.text: I'll do that.

turns.speaker: MRS. O'SHEA
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I need to talk to Annette.

turns.speaker: MRS. O'SHEA
turns.text: She's not here.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Do you know where she is?

turns.speaker: MRS. O'SHEA
turns.text: She's out.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Do you know when she'll be back?

turns.speaker: MRS. O'SHEA
turns.text: Later. Listen, we're entertaining some guests so -

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Annette! Annette!

turns.speaker: MRS. O'SHEA
turns.text: Young man, I already told you she's not here.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Fine. Could you please see that she gets this.

turns.speaker: MRS. O'SHEA
turns.text: I'll do that.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: It's really important.

turns.speaker: MRS. O'SHEA
turns.text: I understand. Good night.

turns.speaker: MRS. SUGERMAN
turns.text: Did I ever tell you the time when my late husband sent me -

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Yes, you already did.

turns.speaker: MRS. SUGERMAN
turns.text: I did?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Right after we played backgammon.

turns.speaker: MRS. SUGERMAN
turns.text: We played backgammon?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Uh huh. You beat me three times.

turns.speaker: MRS. SUGERMAN
turns.text: I did?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Yep. Then I fucked your daughter.

turns.speaker: MRS. SUGERMAN
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I said, do you want some water?

turns.speaker: MRS. SUGERMAN
turns.text: Oh... no thank you...

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: What time is it?

turns.speaker: NIGHT DOORMAN
turns.text: Eight o'clock. You got to go.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Did she show up?

turns.speaker: NIGHT DOORMAN
turns.text: Nope.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Do you mind if I check upstairs?

turns.speaker: NIGHT DOORMAN
turns.text: I can't have you do that, nor can I have you hanging around the lobby all day.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I understand. Thanks for letting me crash here.

turns.speaker: NIGHT DOORMAN
turns.text: Don't worry about it.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Wow. I never knew she had these kind of feelings.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: You're a lucky guy.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: She really loves me.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Ronald, e-mail's for geeks and pedophiles. Be romantic. Write her another letter.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: How will I get to her?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Hey Ronald.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: It seems that you and I have some talking to do.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Can we do it later. I've had a really bad night and -

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Where the hell do you come off hitting women?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Kathryn. Did you hit her?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Kathryn? Oh Christ, she got to you too?

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Did you hit her?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Ronald, you don't know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Don't know what I'm talking about? I know that you fucked Cecile.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Ronald, I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: You bastard!

turns.speaker: MISS CALLAHAN
turns.text: to a situation) Really, Mr. Reed, there isn't anything to worry about. It was only a slap --

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: That's exactly what I told Mr. Reed, but he insisted upon remaining home from business to talk to you, Miss Callahan.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I'm so glad to have met you at last. You're just as nice as Amy told me you were.  I hope you'll come to see us.

turns.speaker: MISS CALLAHAN
turns.text: I'd love to.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Oh, hello.

turns.speaker: MISS CALLAHAN
turns.text: Hello. I just met Amy and she pointed out where you live.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Oliver's pet,  I'm sure it would be the first thing he'd grab if we ever had a fire.

turns.speaker: MISS CALLAHAN
turns.text: I know how it is.  My Dad collects miniature canon.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: But it is a part of our lives too --a part of our past, It's a Goya reproduction. Those three cats --  are supposed to be the most beautifully drawn cats in Western art.

turns.speaker: MISS CALLAHAN
turns.text: But you don't keep a cat, do you?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: We don't even like them,  I've often thought of giving it away, but Oliver wouldn't stand for it.  It was his first wife's favorite picture.  She was an artist.

turns.speaker: MISS CALLAHAN
turns.text: I didn't know Mr. Reed had been married before.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Yes. As a matter of fact, I was on the point of telling you about it yesterday  about Oliver's first marriage  and his wife's death. It has so much to do with Amy  although he'll never realize it.

turns.speaker: MISS CALLAHAN
turns.text: That the old actress -- Julia Farren?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Yes,  She's a little odd, I understand.

turns.speaker: MISS CALLAHAN
turns.text: But quite harmless, I'm sure.

turns.speaker: MISS CALLAHAN
turns.text: Does she go up to the Farren's often?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: No. I only let her go with Edward.  It's alright.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I love the smell of pine.

turns.speaker: MISS CALLAHAN
turns.text: It's one of the clearest memories I have. Twelfth night...burning pine... and mummers' plays.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: It's been ages since I've even thought of a mummers' play. When I was in college we used to do them every year  St. George and the Dragon, all kinds of sword dances.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Forgive me, but it was superstition ...foolish, childish wishes...that started, all this.

turns.speaker: MISS CALLAHAN
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I can see it all...the very day it began. Amy was lonely; she was desperate for friendship. I remember the night she told me she had wished on her ring. That must have been the day she first wished for a friend.

turns.speaker: MISS CALLAHAN
turns.text: It's perfectly normal for a child to dream. I can see how a sensitive little girl, finding this portrait, would take the image of this woman and make of her an imaginary friend. That image dwells only in her imagination, and that image can go as quickly as it was born.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: MISS CALLAHAN
turns.text: Once the emptiness in Amy's life is filled, the dream will go of itself. If a up to you, both of you. Only you two can bring her into a real world.. You must give her the friendship and love she craves.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: You get your wish!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: You know what I wished, Daddy? I wished I could be a good girl.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: But Edward, in this kind of a wish that doesn't matter.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I can make wishes like this come true.  I'll be just like Daddy wants me to be -- play with the other children -- not sit around by myself  tell the truth --

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: What are saying, darling?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I wasn't saying anything. I was singing.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I suppose any note, no matter how sour, is a song if you hold on to it long enough.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: What song, dear?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: The song I was trying to hum. The song my friend, taught me.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Oh, you'll remember it some time.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Mommy --

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Yes, darling.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Did you ever make a wish?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Oh, lots of times.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Did your wishes ever come true?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Sometimes.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I made a wish today, and it came true just like Edward said it would.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Where did you get this ring?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: That's what I wished on. Edward says it's a wishing ring -- and it is!

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: But where did you get it, Amy?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: At the old house with the voice.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Someone gave it to you? Where was this old house?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: On the back street  a green house

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: The Farren house

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Do you know the people?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: No dear. I don't know them, but I've heard about them.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Are they nice?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I really don't know, but I do know that you must return the ring. You get Edward to take you up there and bring it back to the old lady.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Well  the mother or daughter -- whichever one gave it to you. You ask Edward to go with you.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I got my wish anyway.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: You mustn't tell anybody, or it won't come true.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: But it's already come true.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Sh! Then you must keep it true. Goodnight, darling.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Edward will give you your breakfast, Amy.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I had my breakfast while you were still asleep.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Where'd you get this, darling?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: It was right there on top. Isn't she pretty?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: She was very pretty.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: What's her name?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Irena.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Irena.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Look! Why don't you run out and play? The sun's shining.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: All right, mommy.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Oh, thank you, darling.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: You can't open it yet. You have to put all of them under the tree until morning.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Mommy, could Edward take me to Mrs. Farren's house to give her her present?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Wouldn't it be just the same, darling, if daddy dropped the present at Mrs. Farren's on his way to town tomorrow morning?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: But it won't be Christmas tomorrow.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: All right, Amy.  Go tell Edward to take you.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Well, it shows imagination, anyhow.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I wonder if you don't resent that in her?

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: I'm sure I don't, Alice.  It's something else -- something moody -- something sickly --  She could almost be Irena's child.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: I'd hate her to grow up like that.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: She's not Irena's child -- there's nothing of Irena in her. She's my child.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: All I have to do is look at Amy's eyes, blue and deep like yours.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I'm not a jealous woman, Oliver.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: I know that.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: That's why I can tell you, straight out, you think too much about Irena -- blame yourself for her death.  And its your thinking and brooding about her that makes you so unnaturally concerned about Amy.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: No.  It's not that.  It's because I know what can happen when people begin to lie to themselves -- imagine things. I love Amy too much to let her lose herself in a dream world where butterflies become pals. I saw what happened to Irena with her Cat People.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I know, dear.  I understand. But try to worry a little less about her -- be a little easier in your thinking.  And especially today  let's forget about it. We want a really bang-up birthday party, don't we?

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: You make me sound like the father in "East Lynne."

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Darling, no father could be nicer to a child than you are to Amy.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Why don't you take off your hat and stay awhile?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I forgot I had it on.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Where is everybody?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: It's early yet.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: It's nearly a quarter after four. The party was for four, wasn't it?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Yes, darling,

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Gosh, in my day kids arrived at birthday parties before anybody was ready for them,

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Times have changed.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Oilie, that's for the children to play with.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: No kids yet.  Something's gone wrong. Maybe I ought to call somebody.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: All right, Ollie.  Go ahead. Call the Boyds...3000W...see if their darling Donald has left.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: I think I should.  3000W?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Something's haywire,

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: I called not only the Boyds but the Irvings.  Neither of them received invitations.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: But they must have.  Amy and I made them out together.  You mailed them, didn't you, Edward?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: My, my, what a coil we're in! What's this all about?

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Amy's been lying again.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Did you hear the child out?

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Well, it seemed to me --

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: You mean you didn't. It seems to me the least you could do. You can't just jump at conclusions that way. You're being unfair.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: I'm never unfair.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: You're shouting at me.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: I'm not shouting at you, but there's no doubt in my mind that you spoil this child!

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: What is it, Alice?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I thought Amy was calling. I guess not.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Ollie.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: It's your play.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: I'm sorry. I was somewhere else. He returns to the card game.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: I haven't had my breakfast.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Well, you know where it is.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Where did you get it?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Amy picked it off the top of that stack. Perhaps you'd better go through the whole bunch. There may be others of Irena in there.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Some day I'm afraid we're going to have to tell her about Irena.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: I suppose so.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: What's funny?

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: That darn kid. I never in my life expected her to get an A in arithmetic. Math's is a practical science --- if she understands figures, she's well out of her own world of make-believe.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Oliver, please. Let's not go on with this. The child's trembling.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: We've got to go on.  Amy, here, all this time, you've let your mother and father think you had forgotten that old dream life of yours. Now we find you've only kept it secret.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I thought you were with Amy.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: No, she went runnin' off to some old house she was talkin' about yesterday.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: That's the Farren house.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Is that where she got the ring, Mrs. Reed? She shouldn't be up there.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: But I told her to go with you.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: She said something about that, Mrs. Reed  but she didn't tell me it was the Farren house. I'll get my other hat and coat and go over there.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: You do that, Edward.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: It's late, Mommy -- you haven't forgotten my birthday party.

turns.speaker: MISS CALLAHAN
turns.text: Your birthday, Amy --  as she goes) -- and I have something for you in my locker. A present.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Mommy's having a party for me. I asked Robert, and Donald, and Lois --

turns.speaker: MISS CALLAHAN
turns.text: Hello, Amy.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Are you coming to see us. Miss Callahan?

turns.speaker: MISS CALLAHAN
turns.text: No, darling, I hadn't intended to.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I live right here.

turns.speaker: MISS CALLAHAN
turns.text: Maybe I'll drop in and see your Mommy.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I got lots of presents.

turns.speaker: MISS CALLAHAN
turns.text: And you should.  Your mommy tells me you've been such a good girl, and your daddy is so pleased with you.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Is that my birthday cake? May I see?

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: You'll see it when it's all lit and ready for you.
